ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: EDUCATIONAL FACILITIES All the students of the special school benefit from the school activities mainly in the areas of the personal skills such as in eating , dressing ,grooming ,toileting ,etcâ€¦ ; in academic skills they are given stress on concept formation such as alphabets, numbers ,time, money, measurement ,colors, size ,shapes, site word reading ,writing simple additions, etc â€¦.. ;in occupational skills they are taught the simple house hold duties such as gardening, sweeping, dusting, cooking, and pre vocational skills including preparing phenol, candle, garlands, stitching and embroideries etc.â€¦â€¦.. In recreational skills they are given training in both indoor and outdoor games such as cricket, foot ball, ring tennis, bat Minton, skipping, caroms board, etcâ€¦ An hour of physical education and physiotherapy is also the part of the programme. CELEBRATION Teacherâ€™s day, childrenâ€™s day, and other important days were celebrated in the school adding color to the day. On the occasion of childrenâ€™ day students were taken for an outing to a nearby garden. Christmas, Sankaranthi, Ramsan etcâ€¦were celebrated in a fitting manner. VISIT OF THE DIGNITERIES On 22nd October the assistant director along with the superintend visited the school for the inspection of the school WORLD DISABLED DAY On 3rd December 10 students from the school participated in the district and 45 of them in Mandal level disabled day programme. Students participated in the competition conducted in the both Mandal and district level some of them were awarded prizes. NATIONAL IMPORTANCE Independence Day and Republic day were observed in the School MEDICAL CHECKUP Frequent medical checkup of the children are conducted which helped to improve their health condition keep intact. PARENTS MEETING The parents meeting were held every three months. AWARENESS PROGRAMME Staff continuously under takes the counseling of parents of MR children by visiting their houses and by carrying out C.B.R. programme. MAIN ACHIVEMENTS All students coming to the school have improved, most of the students are able to eat their meals & dress their cloth by themselves, few have learnt to make garland, cross stitch embroidery and some are capable of making phenol 7 students are able to make candle by themselves.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: APARD currently works with 6523 families and continues to strive to improve the lives of the poorest in the drought affected areas. APARD has been primarily working in the drought prone western and southern parts of Kurnool District for enhancement of livelihoods of the poor using participatory processes. APARD has been actively promoting and strengthening various peoplesâ€™ institution for different interventions. These institutions include User Groups, Self Help Groups, VOs, Water Users Associations, Sub Committees, distribution committees, seed bank committees, lift irrigation societies etc. In 2001, APARD took responsibility of implementing IV batch watershed programme in Devanakonda Mandal PIA under adverse situations and developed them as model watersheds in the District. This led to the adoption of APRLP approach and process in non-APRLP watersheds also. A seed bank with high yielding variety seeds was established in the watershed village of Karivemula with a focus for increasing productivity in rainfed areas. This has received wide accolades including Agriculture Minister. In addition to the above programmes, APARD has been working for women empowerment, nutrition, Social Forestry, Horticulture, Youth empowerment, Skill Development, Agree Business and Marketing, Water and Sanitation, Sustainable Agriculture, Veterinary Health camps etc. in 243 villages of Kurnool, Kadapa, Prakasam and Anantapur districts.

Active Disorder, Physically Handicapped & Slow Learner. e) To provide Scientific method of education to the children with special needs. f) To open Vocational Education for the mentally challenged hearing impaired cerebral palacy and multiple handicapped. g) To start a rehabilitation center for all handicapped persons. h) to promote manpower development in the area of special education. i) The objects of the society and the Bye-Laws of the society will not be modified, changed or altered or submitted without the prior consent of the Director of Income Tax (Exemption). j) In case of the dissolution of the society, the properties of the society will be handed over to a Society / Trust having similar objectives and which is registered u/s. 12(A) of the Income Tax Act, 1961. k) The investment of the Funds of the society shall be made in accordance with the provision of section 11(5) of the Income Tax Act, 1961. l) Health: To create awareness on overall health among the general population (urban & rural) and provide information on access on health issues in accordance to millennium development goal. m) Education: To Network with various stake holders working in the areas of education & Technical (Primary & Secondary, Collages) to improve the current quality of education as per Millennium development goals. n) Youth and Women Improvement: Involves strategically form relevant groups to help in overall development of the rural and urban development demographics. o) Legal: Provide legal assistants to all beneficiaries in the areas of family welfare, domestic violence and issues with HIV & other infections, diseases control etc.,

ngoList.title: Bethel Educational Society
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Educational Society is running a Old Age Home for the past 15 years. Its is running a High School for the past 26 years, from Nursery to 10th class. It is running a hostel and School for SC & ST children for the past 14 years. it has conducted many training programs for employment generation like Lace Making, Basic Electronics Training for Physically Handicapped Youth, It has worked in the rural regions against the Devadasis system of practice, It worked for the emancipation for all those who are under social discrimination in the name of caste to tribe. It has worked for dry land forming practice in semiarid zones. It worked for organization of beneficiaries officially eligible government welfare programmes. It worked for entrepreneur development training activities for the promotion of rural technology connected with agriculture, Development of Artisans, Training programmes of the unemployed by promoting modified technique in rural technology, Campaigned for the prevention of diseases, Promotion of Hygiene, Eradication of Pollution, Healthy Environment and Campaigned for the importance of sustainable Energy resources. As an organization we are for eradication of poverty, Employment generation, Promotion of rural Industries, Economical Growth, Decentralization, Functional Social Justice, Gender Equality, Protection of Orphan Children, Welfare of the Senior Citizens, Eradication of Imbalances in Geographical zones. It worked for social responsibility, Political Awareness, Economic Promotion and Equality, Protection of Culture, Harmony between different cultural groups, Develop the attitude of scientific temper among people and Promotion of religious Harmony among all sections of the people.
